question_text: Which of the following is/are not a thing as per IoT?
solution: All of these are things as per IoT

question_text: State true or false. Statement: The things in IoT consist of embedded systems.
solution: The things in IoT consist of embedded systems.

question_text: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: IoT is one of the technologies that enable smart farms.
solution: IoT is one of the technologies that enable smart farms.

question_text: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: In M2M, it is mandatory that the interactions between the machines and devices happen through a cloud computing infrastructure.
solution: In M2M, the interactions between the machines and devices can happen through a cloud computing infrastructure.

question_text: Sometimes, when there is a need for the nodes to communicate directly to the Internet, __________ can be used.
solution: Sometimes, there is a need for the nodes to communicate directly to the Internet. This is achieved by tunneling.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: In multi-homing a node/network is connected to only two networks for improved reliability.
solution: In multi-homing, a node/network is connected to multiple networks for improved reliability.

question_text: Which of the following is/are not enablers of IoT?
solution: The enablers of IoT are a. RFID b. Nanotechnology c. Sensors

question_text: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: The decreasing number of devices in IoT is expected to result in an address crunch.
solution: The increasing number of devices in IoT is expected to result in an address crunch.

question_text: Why IoT has become so popular?

options.a: It can provide advanced level of services to the society
options.b: It can help reduce human effort
options.c: It can potentially make processes more efficient

solution: IoT has become popular as It can provide advanced level of services to the society It can help reduce human effort It can potentially make processes more efficient

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. The resolution of a sensor is the maximum change it can detect in the quantity that it is measuring.
solution: The resolution of a sensor is the smallest change it can detect in the quantity that it is measuring.

question_text: Transducer is a __________ term and includes __________.
correct_text: c. collective, both sensors and actuators
solution: Transducer is a collective term and includes both sensors and actuators.

question_text: Which of the following is/are feature/features of sensors?

options.a: It is only sensitive to the measured property.
options.b: It acts on the surrounding environment.

correct_text: a. It is only sensitive to the measured property.
solution: It is only sensitive to the measured property. It does not influence the measure property and does not act on the surrounding environment.

question_text: Which of the following technologies have unified and has resulted in the evolution of IoT?
solution: Unification of technologies which has resulted in the advancement of IoT are a. Low-power embedded systems b. Cloud Computing c. Big Data d. Machine Learning e. Networking

question_text: What is the full form of IoT?
solution: The full form of IoT is "Internet of Things"

question_text: A sensor node is not made up of which of the following?
solution: A sensor node is made up of a combination of sensor/sensors, a processor unit, a radio unit, and a power unit.

question_text: The full form of MQTT is
solution: The full form of MQTT is Message Queue Telemetry Transport.

question_text: Which of the following is NOT a method in MQTT?
solution:
Following are the methods in MQTT - 
a. Connect 
b. Disconnect 
c. Subscribe 
d. Unsubscribe 
e. Publish

question_text: Which of the following is/are component/components of MQTT?
solution:
The three components of MQTT are 
a) Publishers 
b) Subscribers 
c) Brokers

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. SMQTT is an extension of MQTT which uses lightweight attribute based encryption. It has three main stages.
solution: SMQTT is an extension of MQTT which uses lightweight attribute based encryption. It has four main stages.

question_text: The OSI model has __________ layers.
solution: The OSI model is a conceptual framework that divides any networked communication system into seven layers.

question_text: The two sub-layers of CoAP are
solution:
CoAP has two sub-layers which are - 
a) Messaging 
b) Request/response

question_text: What is the full form of AMQP in the context of IoT protocol?
solution: AMQP stands for Advanced Message Queuing Protocol.

question_text: XMPP uses the __________ architecture.
solution: XMPP uses the client-server architecture.

question_text: How many message delivery guarantee modes are there in the AMQP protocol?
solution:
There are three message delivery guarantee modes in the AMQP protocol. 
a. At-most-once 
b. At-least-once 
c. Exactly-once

question_text: Which of the following is/are NOT an AMQP frame type?
solution: Open, close, and end are valid frame types of the AMQP protocol.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: IEEE 802.15.5 was developed for low data rate monitoring and control applications and extended life low power communication uses.
solution: IEEE 802.15.4 was developed for low data rate monitoring and control applications and extended life low power communication uses

question_text: Which of the following is/are exchange types in AMQP?
solution:
The AMQP exchange types are 
a) Direct 
b) Fan-out 
c) Topic 
d) Header

question_text: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: The IEEE 802.15.4 operates in ISM band.
solution: The IEEE 802.15.4 operates in the ISM band.

question_text: The networking topologies supported in the IEEE 802.15.4 are -
solution: The networking topologies defined in IEEE 802.15.4 are star and mesh.

question_text: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: Generation of Route Requests $(RREQs)$ by a LOADng Router for discovering a route to a destination is a valid operation of the LOADng routing protocol.
solution: Generation of Route Requests (RREQs) by a LOADng Router for discovering a route to a destination is a valid operation of the LOADng routing protocol.

question_text: HART operates only in __________ GHz ISM band.
solution: HART operates only in 2.4 GHz ISM band.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: The HART physical layer is derived from IEEE 802.15.4 protocol and operates only in 2.5 GHz ISM band.
solution: The HART physical layer is derived from IEEE 802.15.4 protocol and operates only in 2.4 GHz ISM band.

question_text: State whether the following statement is True or False. Statement: Each node is supervised by the application manager and it guides them on when and where to send packets.
solution: The Network manager supervises each node in the network and guides them on when and where to send packets.

question_text: __________ identifies channels consistently affected by interference and removes them from use.
solution: Channel Blacklisting identifies channels consistently affected by interference and removes them from use.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: The Network Manager supervises each node in the network and guides them on when and where to send packets.
solution: The Network manager supervises each node in the network and guides them on when and where to send packets.

question_text: Which layer of HART incorporates channel hopping and channel blacklisting?
solution: HART Data Link Layer incorporates channel hopping and channel blacklisting.

question_text: WirelessHART relies on __________ for its communication.
solution: WirelessHART relies on mesh networking.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. NFC devices work on the principle of magnetic introduction.
solution: NFC devices work on the principle of magnetic induction.

question_text: Bluetooth technology is based on Ad-hoc technology also known as
solution: Bluetooth technology is based on Ad-hoc technology also known as Ad-hoc Piconets.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Booking in Bluetooth is the process of forming a connection between two Bluetooth devices.
solution: Paging in Bluetooth is the process of forming a connection between two Bluetooth devices.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Class 1 Bluetooth radios are used primarily in industrial use cases and have a range of 100 meters or 300 feet.
solution: Class 1 Bluetooth radios are used primarily in industrial use cases and have a range of 100 meters or 300 feet.

question_text: Zwave uses __________ topology.
solution: Zwave uses Mesh topology.

question_text: Which of the following is an OS for sensor nodes?
solution: TinyOS is an OS for sensor nodes.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Selfish nodes are typified by their unwillingness to cooperate, as the protocol requires whenever there is a personal cost involved.
solution: Selfish nodes are typified by their unwillingness to cooperate, as the protocol requires whenever there is a personal cost involved.

question_text: Dumb behavior of sensor nodes is __________ in nature (as it is dependent on the effects of the environmental conditions).
solution: Dumb behavior of sensor nodes is Temporal in nature (as it is dependent on the effects of the environmental conditions).

question_text: If transmission range > 2* sensing range,
solution: If transmission range >= 2* sensing range, coverage implies connectivity.

question_text: What is the full form of AUV in the context of mobile wireless sensor networks?
solution: The full form of AUV is Autonomous Underwater Vehicle.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Agricultural intrusion detection uses NFC sensors.
solution: Agricultural intrusion detection uses PIR and Ultrasonic sensors.

question_text: The objective of coverage in WSN is to use a __________ number of sensors and __________ the network lifetime.
solution: The objective of coverage in WSN is to use minimum number of sensors and maximize the network lifetime.

question_text: WSN in agriculture uses what for processing?
solution: WSN in agriculture uses Microcontroller for processing.

question_text: Which of the following is/are options for communication among nanodevices?
solution: Electromagnetic and molecular are options for communication among nanodevices

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Voluntary Sensing allows distributed sensing carried by humans and the goal is not just to collect data but to allow the common people to assess and share the knowledge.
solution: Participatory sensing allows distributed sensing carried by humans and the goal is not just to collect data but to allow the common people to assess and share the knowledge.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: UAV networks use a ring topology.
solution:
The following are the features of UAV networks - 
a. Mesh or star networks 
b. Multi-tasking 
c. Large coverage area

question_text: In multi-UAV networks, the scalability is
solution: In multi-UAV networks, the scalability is high.

question_text: Single UAV system uses __________ antenna.
solution: A Single UAV system uses omnidirectional antenna.

question_text: Which of the following is/are constraint/constraints of UAV network?
solution: Frequent link breakages and malfunction are constraints of UAV network.

question_text: Low-end sensor nodes are

options.a: Whose deployment has high density in order to increase network lifetime and survivability.
options.b: Who perform basic functions such as data aggregation, auto configuration, and power saving.

solution:
Low-end sensor nodes are 
a. Whose deployment has high density in order to increase network lifetime and survivability. 
b. Who perform basic functions such as data aggregation, auto configuration, and power saving.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: FANETs are flying ad hoc networks.
solution: FANETs are flying ad hoc networks.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: SCADA is designed for isolated systems using proprietary solutions, whereas M2M is designed for cross-platform integration.
solution: SCADA is designed for isolated systems using proprietary solutions, whereas M2M is designed for cross-platform integration.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Low-end sensor nodes are static, energy-hungry, and complex.
solution: Low-end sensor nodes are static, energy-efficient and simple.

question_text: Why interoperability in IoT is an issue?

options.a: IoT nodes are heterogeneous hence they communicate in different protocols
options.b: IoT nodes are homogeneous and communicate with the same protocol

correct_text: a. IoT nodes are heterogeneous hence they communicate in different protocols
solution: Refer Lecture 21@8:30.

question_text: UNSPSC provides a solution for which of the following?
solution: Refer Lecture 21@16:40.

question_text: Arduino development boards are equipped with micro-controller processors which are __________ with respect to their hardware configurations.
solution: Refer Lecture 22@5:48.

question_text: Translation of inter-device communication forms an important part in solving device interoperability.
solution: Refer Lecture 21@23:43.

question_text: With respect to the different wireless communication protocols such as Zigbee, Bluetooth, GPRS, 6LoWPAN and WiFi, which of the following terms can be associated with?
solution: Refer Lecture 21@9:46.

question_text: Which among the following are valid Arduino datatypes?
solution: Refer Lecture 22@18:28.

question_text: What is the purpose of the delay() function in Arduino programming?

options.d: To make the program go to sleep for a certain duration.

correct_text: d. To make the program go to sleep for a certain duration.
solution: Refer Lecture 22@21:19.
Refer Lecture 23@8:10.

question_text:
What does the following code snippet do in interfacing a servo motor with the Arduino MEGA board?
int servoPin = 12;

options.a: Declares pin for connecting servo motor
options.b: Declares pin for providing power to MEGA board
options.c: Declares pin for Ground supply for servo motor

correct_text: a. Declares pin for connecting servo motor
solution: int servoPin = 12; Declares pin for connecting servo motor.

question_text: State True or False. Statement: "The "Verify" option in the Arduino IDE checks the code for compilation errors."
solution: The "Verify" option in the Arduino IDE checks the code for compilation errors.

question_text: The tool used to select a particular COM port for connecting Arduino to a serial connector is called a sketch.
solution: Sketch in Arduino is the program that is coded in Arduino IDE.

question_text: In general, with respect to any sensor that can be connected to an Arduino board, which of the following is correct?

options.a: The sensor has infinite number of connecting pins
options.b: The sensor will have at least 3 pins (1+Vcc, 1 GND and 1 Data pin)
options.c: The sensor need not connect to the Arduino board.
options.d: The sensor will always have exactly 5 pins.

correct_text: b. The sensor will have at least 3 pins (1 Vcc, 1 GND and 1 Data pin)
solution: This follows from general sensor design principles.

question_text: You connect the +Vcc PIN of a sensor with which of the corresponding PIN of Arduino board.
solution: As per standard Arduino interfacing.

question_text: Servo is a type of
solution: Refer Lecture 25.

question_text: While uploading a sketch to an Arduino board, which of the following should be checked?
correct_text: c. Both Board and Serial Port
solution: Refer Lecture 24 and 25, specifically on the part of uploading sketches to the Arduino board.

question_text: Python programming language can be easily interfaced with different IoT hardware?
solution: Refer Lecture 26@4:47.

GPIO.output(11,True)

question_text: Suppose you have used the sock.bind(server_address) while writing programs with sockets in Python. With respect to this, which among the following is a valid initialization of the server_address object?
solution: Server address tuple always contains the server IP address and port number in order.

question_text: Where do you store the image file of the Raspberry Pi OS before using it to execute the OS on the Pi?

options.c: Inside a memory card attached to the Pi
options.d: OS is installed through wireless means

solution: Raspberry Pi 3 Model B has a GPU support of 400 MHz video core IV.

What is the data type of the variable ls in the following piece of Python code?

question_text: Relay is a type of actuator which can be used with Arduino but not with Raspberry Pi.
solution: Relays can be used with both Arduino as well as Raspberry Pi. They are basic IoT based actuators.

question_text: State whether the following statement is true or false. Statement: Python allows us to only read files. Writing to files is not possible.
solution: Python allows us to read and write files.

question_text: A Raspberry Pi can read data from a sensor but cannot send it over to a remote server for further processing.

question_text: In Python matplotlib, in order to display the graphical plot on a terminal, the command plt.plot() is used in conjunction with which of the following?
solution: Refer Matplotlib tutorials as per Lecture 32.

question_text:
The following Python code displays a parabolic plot using matplotlib.
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
x = np.linspace(-10, 10, 400)
y = x**2
plt.figure(figsize = (8, 6))
plt.xlabel("x", fontname="Times New Roman", fontsize = 12)
plt.ylabel("y", fontname="Times New Roman", fontsize = 12)
plt.title("Plot of a Parabola: y = $x^2$", fontname="Times New Roman", fontsize = 14)
plt.grid(True)
plt.legend(loc="upper left")
plt.axhline(0, color='black', linewidth = 0.5) #x-axis
plt.axvline(0, color='black', linewidth = 0.5) # y-axis
plt.show()
Observe the code very carefully. Will the code plot the desired parabola?
solution: plt.plot() is not included which is the principal method to plot any graph.

question_text: With respect to the above Question (Question 4), which the must be added to make the code display the parabola?
solution: plt.plot() is not included which is the principal method to plot any graph.

question_text:
In Python, suppose that that string text = 'It^is my#birthday!I am*Happy'. What will the output of the following instruction
data = text.split(' ')
print(data[1])
solution: As per Python guidelines.

question_text:
Consider the same text again
text = 'It^is my#birthday!I am*Happy'
Now consider the following instructions. What will be the output?
data = text.split('r')
print(data[1].split('bi')[0])
solution: As per Python guidelines.

question_text: Which among the following is the most suitable utility of Mininet?

options.a: To act as a virtual sensor
options.b: To provide a simulation environment for SDN with OpenFlow
options.c: To act as a generic antenna simulator
options.d: To perform load testing and analysis.

correct_text: b. To provide a simulation environment for SDN with OpenFlow
solution: Refer Lecture 34@12:23.

question_text: Control of end devices such as sensors and actuators do not form a use-case for Software Defined IoT.
solution: Refer Lecture 35@6:06.

options.c: Neither of Soft-WSN and WSN outperform each other
options.d: No relation between Soft-WSN and WSN

solution: Refer Lecture 35@11:37.

question_text: Which of the following is true with respect to Network Virtualization?

options.a: It abstracts the virtual network on a physical network
options.b: It abstracts the physical network on a virtual network
options.c: It is essentially a collection of physical SDN routers
options.d: Network virtualization is a non-existent concept.

correct_text: b. It abstracts the physical network on a virtual network.
solution: Refer Lecture 36@3:57.

question_text: For rule placement at the edge with respect to Software Defined IoT, which of the following is a critical issue that is required to be addressed?

options.c: Mobility of end users and nodes

correct_text: c. Mobility of end users and nodes.
solution: Refer Lecture 36@9:03.

question_text: Which cloud service model allows users to deploy and control their own software, including operating systems, while the provider manages the infrastructure?
solution: Refer Lecture 38, Slide 4, concepts on IaaS.

question_text: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)?

options.b: Requires users to manage the virtual machines
options.d: Simplifies development by abstracting the infrastructure

correct_text: b. Requires users to manage the virtual machines
solution: Refer Lecture 38, Slide 15, concepts on PaaS

question_text: Which essential characteristic of cloud computing refers to the ability of resources to be scaled up or down automatically?
solution: Refer Lecture 37, Slide 9.

question_text: An organization A wants to deploy a cloud infrastructure, whereby it wants to push majority of the data to a cloud whose servers can be situated anywhere within the globe, but it wants certain private data to be pushed only to cloud servers that are present on-premise and are accessible by only authenticated members of the organization. In this context which among the following deployment model should be used?
solution: Hybrid cloud deployment model supports both the features of public and private cloud. Refer lecture 37, ppt No. 18.

question_text: A Private Cloud deployment model cannot provide IaaS but can provide PaaS.
solution: All types of cloud deployment models can provide all types of service models.

question_text: What is the primary function of a Light Virtual Access Point (LVAP) in the ODIN architecture for SDN-based IoT?

options.a: Acts as a firewall between user devices and access points
options.b: Enables virtualization of Wi-Fi APs for per-client network control
options.c: Encrypts user traffic before forwarding to the cloud
options.d: Controls routing at the backbone of the network

correct_text: b. Enables virtualization of Wi-Fi APs for per-client network control
solution: Refer Lecture 36, Slide 12.

question_text: With respect to Virtualization, if one VM runs on a hypervisor, another VM is unable to use the hypervisor.?
solution: Refer Lecture 38@5:16.

question_text: Through which of the following cloud service model, do you use an image editing application without explicitly installing the said application on your local system?
solution: This is an example of SaaS, since you are accessing a an application as a client over the network. The actual software itself runs on some remote cloud server (Please refer Lecture 37@26:14 AND 38@13:16)

question_text: Which of the following best defines 'measured service' in cloud computing?

options.a: Cloud resources are billed only annually
options.b: Users must request reports manually for resource usage
options.c: Cloud systems automatically control and optimize resources based on metering

correct_text: c. Cloud systems automatically control and optimize resources based on metering
solution: Refer Lecture 37, Slide No 10

question_text: With respect to Cloud security, which of the following is expected to have a higher level of security than the other in a very generic sense, on the assumption that on-premise data storage generally is more secure than off-premise data storage.
solution: Private cloud stores data on-premise, so on this assumption, it is more secure than public cloud. Refer Lecture 39 on Cloud Security.

question_text: Data security and client authentication is an issue in which of the following cloud service models?
solution: Security is a pertinent issue in all of the cloud service models, which includes SaaS, PaaS and IaaS. Refer to any standard discussion on challenges and issues on cloud computing and Lecture 39.

question_text: In cloud computing, the users have specific knowledge about the exact physical location of the computing hardware with respect to the cloud services.
solution: In cloud computing, the users have no knowledge about the backend physical hardware orchestration and management. Refer Lecture 37.

question_text: GreenCloud implementation focuses most on which of the following aspects?
solution: Refer Lecture 40@14:48.

question_text: Fog is the layer between which two layers?
solution: Fog is the layer between Cloud and IoT. See Lecture 45 @ 07:04

question_text: Which of the following is/are the actors in sensor-cloud?
solution: The actors in sensor-cloud include end users, sensor-owner and SCSP. (Please refer Lecture 42@14:24)

question_text: Which of the following are considered key limitations of Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs)?
solution: WSNs face several limitations beyond just hardware cost, including the complexity of procurement, difficulty in physical deployment, and ongoing maintenance issues. (Please refer: Lecture 42 @ 10:52)

question_text: Which of the following takes the decision whether the data should be provided directly to the end user or is it required to re-cache the data from external cache?
solution: Internal Cache takes the decision whether the data should be provided directly to the end user or is it required to re-cache the data from external cache. (Please refer Lecture 43@22:13)

question_text:
Fill in the blanks
The __________ extends the cloud nearer the IoT devices.
solution: Fogging or fog computing extends the cloud nearer the IoT devices. (Please refer Lecture 44@6:33)

question_text: Which of the following is/are the types of data with respect to sensitivity.
solution: Time-sensitive, less time-sensitive and not time-sensitive are the types of data with respect to sensitivity. (Please refer Lecture 44@20:05)

question_text: Who coined the term Fog computing?
solution: CISCO coined the term Fog computing. (Please refer Lecture 44@4:18)

question_text: What of the following is an advantage of fog computing ?
solution: Fog computing supports anywhere deployability and mobility. (Please refer Lecture 45@21:21)

question_text:
State True or False
Openstack is an open-source software.
solution: Openstack is an open-source software. (Please refer Lecture 41@2:14)

question_text: To what are the fog nodes connected to?
solution: The fog nodes are connected to the IoT devices and Cloud. (Please refer Lecture 45@11:05)

question_text: Which of the following reduces danger and increases output?
solution: Dynamic analysis and decision making reduces danger and increases output. (Please refer Lecture 45@25:00)

question_text: Fill in the blanks. Fog computing is an intermediate layer between __________ and __________.
solution: Fog computing is an intermediate layer between Cloud and devices. (Please refer Lecture 44@6:40)

question_text: Unnecessary sensing causes energy consumption.
solution: Unnecessary sensing causes energy consumption. (Please refer Lecture 43@20:54)

question_text: Which of the following is used by the fog applications to increase the speed of service accessibility?
solution: Accelerators increase the speed of service accessibility. (Please refer to Page 260, Chapter 11, Introduction to IoT. S. Misra, A. Mukherjee, and A. Roy, 2020. Cambridge University Press.)

solution: The concept of hardware virtualization enables physical hardware to be shared among multiple entities. (Please refer to Page 262, Chapter 11, Introduction to IoT. S. Misra, A. Mukherjee, and A. Roy, 2020. Cambridge University Press.)

question_text: DLNA (used in HAN standards) expands to:
solution: DLNA = Digital Living Network Alliance. (Lecture 48 @ 13:49)

question_text: Which property best characterizes V2X?
solution: V2X follows a distributed architecture. (Lecture 49 @ 12:06)

question_text: Which set correctly captures smart-home functionality?
correct_text: c. Both health monitoring and security

question_text: Which are valid types of sensing?
solution: Sensing can be stationary or mobile. (Lecture 47 @ 19:36)

question_text: Which layers are part of the Zigbee stack?
solution: Zigbee includes Physical, MAC, and Network layers. (Lecture 48 @ 16:23)

question_text: Smart parking primarily reduces traffic
solution: Smart parking reduces traffic congestion. (Lecture 47 @ 16:58)

question_text: About Home Area Network (HAN), consider: I) Multi-protocol gateway bridges non-IP to IP. II) Wired HAN is low cost. III) Wireless HAN makes implementation easy. Which of these is correct?
solution: All three are correct per lecture context. (Lecture 48 @ 11:24)

question_text: Which statements about smart health are true? I) Low-cost and portable II) Allows remote check-ups and diagnosis III) Effortless health monitoring
solution: All listed properties were highlighted in lecture. (Lecture 46 @ 26:12)_

question_text: Phases of Intelligent Connected Vehicle (ICV) development include:
solution: Three phases as listed. (Lecture 50 @ 12:28)

question_text: In the Ad-hoc domain of VANET, vehicles are:
solution: Vehicles are mobile in the ad-hoc domain. (Lecture 50 @ 16:59)

question_text: Domains of VANET include:
solution: In-vehicle and Ad-hoc are VANET domains (per the lecture scope). (Lecture 50 @ 14:36)

question_text: At which data fusion stage are multiple classifier outputs combined?
solution: Ensemble of decisions happens at the decision level. (Lecture 47 @ 11:23)

question_text: The Body & Brain Architecture consists of how many layers?
solution: It consists of three layers. (Lecture 49 @ 23:09)

question_text: Which statement about smart home infrastructure is correct?

options.b: It may include wired and/or wireless devices.

correct_text: b. It may include wired and/or wireless devices.
solution: Smart homes can use wired and/or wireless devices. (Lecture 48 @ 6:17)

question_text: Intelligent Connected Vehicles (ICV) communication is based on:
solution: ICV is based on DSRC. (Lecture 50 @ 7:22)

question_text: What are some of the other names of the smart grids?
solution: Smart grids are also known as Electricity with a brain, Energy internet, and Electronet. (Please refer Lecture 51@8:33)

question_text: Which of the following is not done in traditional electrical grids?
solution: In Traditional electrical grids, the energy generation is done in centralised power plants. (Please refer Lecture 51@5:45)

question_text: Which of the following is a benefit associated with smart grids for customers?
solution: Smart Grids provide different pricing options for customers, lower electricity rates and Improved security. (Please refer Lecture 51@16:33)

question_text: Fill in the blank. __________ samples voltage and current with a fixed sample rate at the installed location.
solution: PMUs or Phasor Measurement Unit samples voltage and current with a fixed sample rate at the installed location (Please refer Lecture 52 @2:44)

question_text:
Which of the following statements are true about MDMSs?
Statement I: Decide the price per unit energy to be paid by the customers
Statement II: Handled by the energy service providers
Statement III: Aggregate the energy consumption or energy request of certain geographical area
solution: The Meter Data Management Systems (MDMS) decide the price per unit energy to be paid by the customers AND are handled by the energy service providers. (Please refer Lecture 52@16:02)

question_text: Which of the following aggregate the energy consumption or energy request of a certain geographical area?
solution: DAUs aggregate the energy consumption or energy request of a certain geographical area. (Please refer Lecture 52@15:17)

question_text:
Which of the following statements are true about Dynamic System Attacks?
Statement I: Replay attacks compromises sensors and monitors their outputs.
Statement II: D-DIA can lead to a system collapse.
Statement III: Covert attack is a closed loop version of replay attacks.
correct_text: d. Statements I, II and III
solution: Replay attacks compromises sensors and monitors their outputs. D-DIA can lead to a system collapse. Covert attack is a closed loop version of replay attacks. (Please refer Lecture 52@20:03)

question_text: Fill in the blank. __________ is performed by compromising the availability of the grid component.
solution: Denial of service is performed by compromising the availability of the grid component. (Please refer Lecture 52@19:52)

question_text: Fill in the blank. __________ is a primary challenge in IIoT.

options.c: Integrate existing infrastructure into new IIoT infrastructure

correct_text: d. Integrate existing infrastructure into new IIoT infrastructure
solution: Integrate existing infrastructure into new IIoT infrastructure is one of the primary challenges of IIoT. (Please refer Lecture 54@14:02)

question_text: Fill in the blank. __________ is based on a wrap and re-use approach.
solution: IIoT is based on the wrap and re-use approach. (Please refer Lecture 53@9:51)

question_text: Mechanized production is a part of the 4th Industrial Revolution.
solution: Mechanized production is a part of the 1st Industrial Revolution. (Please refer Lecture 53@10:41)

question_text: Which of the following happened in the 3rd Revolution?
solution: Internet evolution and automation happened in the 3rd Revolution. (Please refer Lecture 53@ 10:06)

question_text: Which of the following is not a vulnerability of Smart Grid?
solution: Integrity, physical threats and dynamic system attacks are all the vulnerabilities of smart grids (Please refer Lecture 52@ 16:56)

question_text: Big data is characterized by 7 Vs.
solution: Big data is characterized by 7 Vs. (Please refer Lecture 55@10:36)

question_text: What is the Flow of data?
solution: The flow of the data is Generation, Acquisition, Storage and Analysis (Please refer Lecture 55@19:29)

question_text: The two types of data analysis are
solution: Qualitative and Quantitative are the two types of data analysis. (Please refer Lecture 56@2:33)

question_text: Fill in the blank. To perform an ANOVA, we must have a __________ response variable and at least one __________ factor.
solution: To perform an ANOVA, we must have a continuous response variable and at least one categorical factor. (Please refer Lecture 56@9:24)

question_text:
Select the statement(s) that denote the type of ANOVA.
Statement I: One way analysis
Statement II: Two way analysis
Statement III: K-way analysis
correct_text: c. Statements I, II, and III
solution: The types of ANOVA includes One way analysis, Two way analysis and K-way analysis (Please refer Lecture 56@11:57)

question_text: What is the type of the data dispersion?
solution: Range, average absolute deviation and variation are the type of data dispersions. (Please refer Lecture 56@13:43)

question_text: The two most relevant sensors directly used in agricultures are

options.b: Soil moisture and water level sensor
options.c: ECG sensor and water level sensor

correct_text: b. Soil moisture and water level sensor
solution: Soil moisture and water level sensors are the necessary sensors generally used in agriculture. (Please refer Lecture 57@13:11)

question_text: The mathematical equation that is formulated in the form of relationships between variables is known as
solution: The mathematical equation that is formulated in the form of relationships between variables is known as Statistical model (Please refer Lecture 56@7:53)

question_text: What are the two types of statistical models?
solution: Complete and incomplete are two types of statistical models (Please refer Lecture 56@8:11)

question_text: Select the correct order of the component layers present in the IoT healthcare.

options.a: Sensing layer, cloud platform layer, aggregated layer, processing layer
options.b: Sensing layer, aggregated layer, processing layer, cloud platform layer
options.c: Aggregated layer, sensing layer, processing layer, cloud platform layer
options.d: Sensing layer, processing layer, aggregated layer, cloud platform layer

correct_text: b. Sensing layer, aggregated layer, processing layer, cloud platform layer
solution: The sensing layer senses data and transmit it o the aggregation layer where the data are aggregated. The aggregated layer further transfers the data to the processing layer the data are processed and final sent to the cloud platform. (Please refer Lecture 58@8:25)

question_text: Wireless IoT driven solutions for remote healthcare facility provisioning brings healthcare to patients than bringing patients to healthcare.
solution: In IoT healthcare, wireless IoT driven solutions brings healthcare to patients than bringing patients to healthcare. (Please refer Lecture 58@11:40)

question_text: Which of the following handheld devices are used for activity monitoring?
solution: High end smartphones are likely to have accelerometer, compass, and gyroscope. (Please refer Lecture 59@15:29)

question_text: Which of the following are components of IoT?
solution: Sensing layer, Aggregated layer, Processing layer and cloud platform are components of IoT. (Please refer Lecture 58@8:17)

question_text: By performing continuous monitoring of a person's activity, it is not possible to observe his/her behavior or to identify any repetitive pattern in his/her day-to-day activity.
solution: Continuous monitoring of activity results in daily observations of human behavior and repetitive patterns in their activity. (Please refer Lecture 59@14:33)

question_text: Deep learning based data analysis cannot be performed on videos
solution: Deep learning based data analysis can be done on sensor data, images and videos. (Please refer Lecture 59@19:34)

question_text: Which of the following are the inbuilt sensors that are present in high end smartphones?
solution: High end smartphones are likely to have accelerometer, compass, and gyroscope. (Please refer Lecture 60@2:28)

question_text: Fill in the blank. Processing the handheld activity device data with artificial intelligence can be used for
solution: Processing the handheld activity device data with artificial intelligence can be used for detecting sudden fall of a person. (Please refer Lecture 60@11:56)
